title: Personality & Work Style
description: Deep dive into your personality traits and how you naturally approach work

questions.question: When starting a new project, how much planning do you need before diving in?
questions.minLabel: I jump right in and figure it out
questions.maxLabel: I need a detailed plan first

questions.question: In a team meeting, which role do you naturally gravitate toward?

options.label: Leading the discussion and driving decisions
Contributing ideas and suggestions
Analyzing proposals and finding issues
Supporting others and building consensus
Observing and speaking when I have something important

questions.question: Which personality traits describe you best? (Select 3-5)

options.label: Analytical - I break things down logically
Creative - I think outside the box
Detail-oriented - I notice small things
Big-picture thinker - I see the forest, not trees
Empathetic - I understand people well
Decisive - I make decisions quickly
Perfectionist - I want everything just right
Pragmatic - I focus on what works
Curious - I always want to learn more
Persistent - I don't give up easily

questions.question: How do you recharge energy after intense work?
questions.maxLabel: Social time - I energize with people

questions.question: When you receive critical feedback on your work, what's your initial reaction?

options.label: Defensive - I feel the need to explain
Analytical - I assess if the feedback is valid
Grateful - I appreciate the opportunity to improve
Discouraged - It affects my confidence
Motivated - I'm excited to address it

questions.question: How comfortable are you with multitasking vs focusing on one thing?
questions.minLabel: I prefer deep focus on one task

questions.question: How do you handle routine, repetitive tasks?

options.label: I immediately look for ways to streamline or simplify them
I optimize and batch them for efficiency
I tolerate them as necessary
I procrastinate or try to delegate them
I find them meditative and calming

questions.question: Rate your natural risk tolerance in professional decisions
questions.minLabel: Very risk-averse - I prefer safe choices

questions.question: What's your natural approach to deadlines?

options.label: I finish well before deadlines
I make steady progress toward deadlines
I work best under last-minute pressure
Depends on the project and stakes

questions.question: What conditions help you do your best work? (Select all that apply)

options.label: Quiet, distraction-free environment
Music or ambient sound
Collaborative, energetic atmosphere
Flexible hours, not 9-5
Clear goals and expectations
Autonomy to choose my approach
Structure and established processes
Variety in tasks and challenges

questions.question: Describe a situation where you felt 'in flow' and highly productive (from work, school, hobbies, or any activity)
questions.placeholder: What were you doing? What made it feel effortless? It can be from any area of your life...

questions.question: How much do you need external validation vs internal satisfaction?
When learning something new, how do you prefer to start?

options.label: Understand the theory and concepts first
Jump in hands-on and learn by doing
Study examples and replicate them
Follow a structured curriculum
Mix of theory and practice

questions.question: How comfortable are you being the 'expert' or go-to person?
questions.minLabel: Uncomfortable - I prefer to learn from others
questions.maxLabel: Energized - I love being the expert

questions.question: What's a situation where you significantly changed your approach after reflection?
questions.placeholder: Describe what you learned about yourself
